author: NewsBreak Original
title: North Carolina Woman 'Got The Shakes' After Huge Lottery Win
text:
By Sarah Tate ,
1 hour ago Photo: Khosrork/iStock/Getty Images A woman in North Carolina is "stoked" and "overjoyed" after scoring a huge jackpot win in a recent lottery drawing.
Kemisha Vandunk , of Spring Lake, recently purchased Quick Pick ticket for the Monday (February 26) Cash 5 drawing while grabbing some coffee at the Short Stop on Anderson Ponds Drive, according to a release from the NC Education Lottery . The ticket she bought ended up beating the 1 in 962,598 odds to match the numbers on all five balls called during the drawing.
"It was just like any normal day and then boom ," she said, laughing.
When Vandunk arrived at lottery headquarters in Raleigh on Tuesday (February 27), she was surprised to learn just how much she won. Because she and another lucky player in Fairview each had winning tickets, the $266,630 jackpot was split, with each getting $133,315.
"When we got here and they told us how much it was, I was overjoyed," she told lottery officials. "I thought I won maybe $1,000."
The Cumberland County woman ended up taking home a total of $95,321 after all required state and federal tax withholdings, which she said "will definitely help" her with her retirement plans and dreams for her family. She told lottery officials she hopes to put away part of the prize for retirement while using some of the funds in her family's trucking business.
"I've got the shakes," she said. "I am stoked right now."
Expand All Read in NewsBreak

author: Clarin.com - Home
title: Cómo recuperar las fotos que borraste por error de tu Android o iPhone
text: Gracias a su accesibilidad inigualable y las mejoras constantes de sus cámaras integradas, los celulares se convirtieron en la herramienta preferida de los usuarios para capturar momentos especiales y cotidianos de manera conveniente y rápida. La facilidad de capturar múltiples imágenes y descartar aquellas que no cumplen con las expectativas puede provocar, en ocasiones, que eliminemos accidentalmente alguna fotografía valiosa. Ante este dilema surge la pregunta de cómo recuperarla. Tanto para Android como para Apple existen diferentes pasos a seguir a la hora de recuperar una foto eliminada. Cómo recuperar una foto eliminada desde Google Fotos Desde la aplicación Google Fotos, que agrupa fotografías y vídeos del dispositivo con aquellas que se encuentran guardadas en la nube, se puede recuperar una foto eliminada desde el apartado de papelera. Cuando se elimina una imagen desde Google Fotos, no se borra definitivamente, sino que queda en la papelera, donde permanece un tiempo antes de la eliminación total. De esta forma, se puede prevenir eliminar por error ciertos archivos. Para abrir este apartado hay que ir a Biblioteca, para después pulsar en Papelera, en la parte superior y desde ahí es posible seleccionar las fotos o videos que se quieran recuperar o en su defecto que se quieran eliminar definitivamente. Cabe destacar, que si pasan 60 días y no se ha restaurado el elemento, Google lo borrará de forma automática. En cambio, será de 30 días el plazo si el archivo está guardado de forma local, sin copia de seguridad en la nube. Cómo recuperar una foto eliminada desde la papelera de Galería Varios celulares Samsung o Xiaomi utilizan su propia aplicación en lugar de Google Fotos, es por eso que para recuperar archivos eliminados deberás buscarlos en un apartado de la galería de tu dispositivo. Esta sección guarda las imágenes o videos eliminados recientemente, en caso de que se quieran recuperar al poco tiempo de haberlas borrado. El tiempo que permanecen las imágenes en esta sección depende de cada fabricante, pero normalmente es alrededor de 30 días. Para encontrar este apartado hay que explorar las opciones de la app de galería, o los álbumes que se encuentran dentro de esta. Cómo recuperar fotos borradas de iPhone Para recuperar archivos eliminados en un celular iPhone se deberá recurrir a iCloud, el sistema de almacenamiento de Apple que guarda fotos, archivos, notas, contraseñas y otros datos en la nube. En cambio, si los archivos fueron eliminados desde otras apps deberás hacer clic en la barra de herramientas, luego en “Recuperación de datos” y en “Restaurar archivos”, después seleccionar lo quieras recuperar y finalmente hacer clic en restaurar. De esta manera habrás recuperado cualquier archivo que haya sido eliminador por error. Newsletter Clarín Tags relacionados

author: Michael Addvensky
title: Tiffany Smiley: Our Commander-in-Chief Continues To Show Weakness On The World Stage | Fox Across America
text: Former GOP candidate for U.S. Senate in Washington State Tiffany Smiley joins Fox Across America With guest host Jason Chaffetz to shed light on why the U.S. military is currently facing a recruiting crisis. “There’s a lower percentage of individuals that are serving and most of those that join the military are from military families. So I believe we need to expand that. We need patriotism back in this country. And we need a Commander-in-Chief who’s strong, who leads from a place of strength, peace through strength. And unfortunately, sort of what I was talking about at the beginning is Joe Biden showed weakness on the world stage with the failed departure in Afghanistan, deeply hurt our military families. You know, to see how much so many families have sacrificed. I mean, we have friends who have been in Afghanistan more than they have in the United States of America and away from their families. And to watch that failure on the world stage is just set us up to be stretched thin. We’re not meeting our recruiting goals. There’s not a sense of strength and peace through strength. Right? And that starts at the top. That’s in any organization. And if our Commander-in- Chief is showing weakness on the world stage, I mean, our military families are the ones holding us up and they’re the ones that are exhibiting courage and bravery every single day in the face of an administration that is unable to stand up and show the world that we are a shining beacon on the hill. It is our military families that are absolutely doing it day in and day out.” Listen to the podcast to hear what else she had to say to Jason! PLUS, don’t forget to pre-order your copy of Jimmy’s upcoming book! [Pre-Order Cancel Culture Dictionary ](https://www.foxnews.com/books/cancel-culture-dictionary)

author: Times Of India
title: 90% of budget promises for this fiscal fulfilled, says CM | Goa News - Times of India
text: Panaji: Chief minister Pramod Sawant on Thursday said that only 10% of his budget promises are remaining to be completed and another 5% would be fulfilled in the next assembly session as various bills will be introduced. He added that 90% of his budgetary promises have either commenced or completed for the financial year 2023-2024. Chief minister told TOI that he will place an action taken report on the budget in the assembly to inform the public about the performance of his government.“I can say that only 10% budgetary promises are left to be started. Of these 5% are related to ease of doing business and some amendments to the existing law will be done in the budget session,” Sawant said, adding that most of the promised projects will take a year or two for completion. Last week, the cabinet granted its approval to summon the budget session from February 2. Sawant said that the assembly’s business advisory committee will decide the number of days for the session.Opening his second innings with the first budget of the newly-elected BJP government, Sawant presented a Rs 24,467.4 crore budget for 2022-23 with a strong focus on job creation and on making Goa self-reliant. The chief minister chose to leave taxes unchanged and promised to increase the state’s dwindling income through reforms. The Economic Survey makes the state government’s economic predictions clear, with deposits in banks outpacing the state’s gross state domestic product. Goa’s GSDP is estimated at Rs 91,416 crore in the coming financial year indicating a 7% growth, but total bank deposits have already outpaced the economy to stand at Rs 93,618 crore.Among the many reforms that Sawant promised to introduce is the implementation of e-governance measures such as e-office and e-HRMS, which will enable the government to go paperless and maintain a centralised database of employees.To promote entrepreneurship and job creation in the state, the budget promised to create women entrepreneurship development programmes at district and state level. He also said that the government would launch a dedicated entrepreneurship policy, while a study will also be conducted to identify the mismatch between demand and supply of trained workforce.

organizations.name: goa news - times of india panaji

author: TOI Entertainment Desk
title: 'The Bachelor' fame Rachael Kirkconnell breaks silence on split with Matt James: "He just did not see a future with me"
text: Nearly two weeks after her unexpected breakup with Matt James, 'The Bachelor' alum Rachael Kirkconnell is opening up about what led to their separation. During a candid appearance on the Call Her Daddy podcast on January 28, she revealed the real reason behind their split and the emotional rollercoaster she endured while navigating the fallout.Kirkconnell, who won James’ final rose in 2021, shared that their breakup unfolded during a trip to Tokyo. According to her, James admitted he had lingering doubts about their long-term compatibility.“At the end of the day, there were just certain qualities about me that he wasn’t sure he wanted in a wife,” she explained. “He said there were things we weren’t aligned on, and that worried him.”She recalled that he had a moment of realization, telling her, “By now, I should be ready to propose. I should feel certain about our future, but I still don’t. And I don’t know if I ever will.”Her response was direct “If you don’t know after four years, then we probably shouldn’t be together. You know me better than anyone, so by now, you should have a clear answer.”Rachael described the days leading up to their split as confusing, especially since James had recently reassured her about their relationship.“A few days before, he was telling me how lucky he was to have me, how much he appreciated our relationship,” she said. “He would point out other couples and say how grateful he was that we didn’t have the same struggles.”However, cracks started to form when they had a minor disagreement over dinner plans in Tokyo. Rachael admitted she got emotional over picking a restaurant that didn’t meet their expectations, which led James to question her reaction.But even then, she didn’t anticipate what was coming next.“It felt like everything was fine,” she said. “Then, suddenly, it wasn’t.”Even as the conversation took a serious turn, Rachael wanted clarity.“I asked him straight up, ‘Is this about me, or is it something you’re afraid of? Are you scared of commitment, or do you genuinely believe I’m not the right person for you?’”“He said he just didn’t think I was the one, and he didn’t want me to waste any more time waiting for something that might never happen,” she shared.His final words to her were bittersweet: “You’re beautiful, smart, and funny, and you’ll find someone who loves you for you. But I don’t think that person is me.”The heartbreak didn’t end there. Just hours later, while Rachael was on a plane leaving Japan, she learned that James had already gone public with the breakup.“We were getting ready to take off, and my phone started blowing up,” she said. “One of my best friends texted me, ‘Rach??’ followed by a bunch of question marks. Then she sent another message saying, ‘I saw Matt’s post. Is this real?’”With the plane taking off and no Wi-Fi access for the next 12 hours, Rachael was left to process the breakup now a public spectacle alone.“I had just been broken up with, and now the whole world knew before I could even catch my breath,” she said. “I was in complete shock.”Adding to her confusion was the fact that, just a few months prior, they had discussed engagement. “We talked about rings,” she revealed. “He even told me to start thinking about what I wanted, that we should go look at some together. That made me believe he was serious about the future.”But as their relationship continued, small tensions turned into larger doubts. “We had arguments about silly things—what to eat, where to go—but underneath that, there was a bigger issue. He was holding back something he had felt for a while,” she quoted.
